author: Special Correspondent
text:
C. Sridhar, Inspector General (IG) of Police, West Zone, held discussion with the Superintendents of Police of four districts in Salem Range, here recently, on the steps to be taken for maintaining law and order and peace during the Assembly elections.

He directed the police officials to ensure regular visits to sensitive areas and polling stations. The officials should identify the anti-social elements and listed persons in the respective police station limits and closely watch their movements. All effective steps should be taken to ensure peaceful elections, the IG said.

P. Nagarajan, Deputy Inspector General (DIG) of Police, Salem Range, SPs G. Subbulakshmi (Salem), S. Maheswaran (Namakkal), J. Loganathan (Dharmapuri) and R. Tirunavukkarasu (Krishnagiri) participated in the meeting. Later in the evening, Mr. Sridhar addressed a meeting of the Deputy Superintendents of Police and Inspectors of Salem district police. Mr. Sridhar also addressed a meeting of the Deputy SPs and Inspectors of Police of Namakkal district in Namakkal District Police Office.

Directs police officials to ensure regular visits to sensitive areas and polling stations.
title: IG holds meeting with SPs of western districts
